meanings.definition: The state or quality of being dumb or lacking intelligence.
meanings.sent1: Her dumbnesses in class made it hard for her to understand the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The professor was concerned about the student's dumbnesses in solving the math problem.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dumbnesses, he always tried his best to learn new things.
meanings.sent4: The dumbnesses of the criminal's plan was evident to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The teacher worked hard to help the student overcome his dumbnesses in reading.

meanings.definition: The act of being silent or unable to speak.
meanings.sent1: The awkward silence in the room was filled with dumbnesses.
meanings.sent2: His sudden dumbnesses during the presentation surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The dumbnesses of the shy girl made her blush.
meanings.sent4: The dumbnesses of the mute character added depth to the play.
meanings.sent5: The dumbnesses of the library was broken only by the sound of turning pages.

meanings.definition: A foolish or senseless action or behavior.
meanings.sent1: His dumbnesses in spending all his money on toys left him broke.
meanings.sent2: The daredevil's dumbnesses in risking his life for a thrill worried his friends.
meanings.sent3: The dumbnesses of trying to fit a square peg into a round hole was evident.
meanings.sent4: Her dumbnesses in believing everything she heard led to many misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The dumbnesses of ignoring the warning signs resulted in a preventable accident.
